content: Seedly PFF 2019 Investments Savings CPF Insurance Asked by Gabriel ThamAsked on 23 Apr 2019What's your wishlist of speakers and events at Seedly Personal Finance Festival 2020?What's your wishlist of speakers and events at Seedly Personal Finance Festival 2020?7 answersAnswerBump4

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Can I say me? Haha. I'd love to have a guy who has a better understanding of Behavioral Finance. Sometimes it's not all about the ROI you see. Making money decisions affect all the theory there is available on investment returns, etc.1 comment5
Gabriel Tham23 Apr 2019Woo yes you can be a speaker!

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 23 Apr 2019My wishlist speakers are:Joshua Giersch aka the one and only Shiny Things and Author of the book Rich by Retirement.Andrew Hallam, author of Millionaire Teacher0 comments4

Serene TohLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Actually CPF seems to be a big discussion point. It would be interesting to have an educated debate on the Pros & Cons of CPF as an Investment & Retirement Strategy.P/s: For the less financially educated masses, I would highly recommend CPF to them, but it might not be the best product for the more financially savvy.3 comments4

See all 3 comments Serene Toh26 Apr 2019That comment was more of a question than a statement. I do support the use of CPF. But I realised that the forum is too Pro CPF, so kinda want the discussion to balance it out a bit. So that the issues for the doubtful people can be properly address, and we can't do that unless we look at the cons. You can't really convince people unless you make them feel that you heard them. Problem is, this is such a sensitive issue,that if not handled delicately, might blow up in our faces.Loh Tat Tian15 May 2019CPF risk are always there.
1) Political Risk of change on CPF matters, especially withdrawal, retirement age etc

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Someone who can do personality profiling. Will help an individual understand self better, how to handle finances and what is the risk profile when it comes to investing.Possibly a Jerry Maguire type person who can show us the money.2 comments2

Loh Tat Tian15 May 2019Hey, I just learned about Bazi and it seems to work for me (especially for my job). :P might be useful to learn how to get funds and expand the wealth capacity haha!Jonathan Chia Guangrong15 May 2019Actually I'm thinking more in line with non religion linked types of personality profiling.
